functionalRequirements:
### Business Objectives
1. Provide comprehensive entity management visibility
2. Facilitate metadata exploration for developers and business analysts
3. Enable efficient system navigation through hierarchical visualization

### User Needs
- Developers need technical metadata (data types, relationships, constraints)
- Business users need contextual explanations and operational impact information
- System administrators require permission visibility and schema overview

### Data Requirements
Dynamic data access required for:
- Entity metadata (name, description, creation date)
- Field metadata (data type, format, relationships)
- Permission settings per entity/field

### Functional Requirements
**Entity Hierarchy Display**
- Tree structure with expand/collapse icons
- Visual indicators for child entity counts
- Context-sensitive tooltips showing entity summaries

**Drill-Down Functionality**
- Click-to-navigate between entities
- Breadcrumb trail for navigation path
- Modal/pane toggle for field details

**Metadata Display**
- Field grids with columns: Name, Type, Description, Relationship, Permission
- Technical vs Business explanation tabs
- Schema diagram visualization (ERD-style)

**Search & Filter**
- Global search bar with fuzzy matching
- Filter by: entity type, data class, modification date
- Tag-based categorization (e.g., 'PII', 'Financial')

**Contextual Information**
- Business impact ratings per field
- Usage statistics (how often accessed)
- Version history of schema changes

**Accessibility**
- Keyboard navigation
- Screen reader compatibility
- High-contrast mode

### Success Metrics
- 90% reduction in entity lookup time
- 75% increase in metadata utilization
- 95% user satisfaction in usability surveys

requiredEntities.entityDescription: Catalog of all entities across schemas
Metadata for entity fields including permissions

dynamicData.description: Data strategy leverages metadata entities to enable hierarchical navigation (ParentID in Entities), field-level permissions (AllowUpdateAPI in Entity Fields), and relationship visualization (Entity Relationships)

dataRequirements.securityNotes: Entity permissions should be enforced through Entity Fields' AllowUpdateAPI and Entities' security attributes

techExplanation: The EntityViewer leverages a modular, compositional architecture. The root maintains navigation, search/filter, display mode and accessibility state. Data is fetched dynamically on-demand per user action, scoped by permission. Child components are responsible for rendering specific UI sub-tasks and communicate state/control changes to the parent for coordinated updates. Accessible navigation and ARIA support is prioritized throughout, with business and technical views surfaced at multiple levels. Components are designed for virtualization and efficient updates. Errors or permission blocks are handled gracefully via feedback and ARIA live regions.

childComponents.exampleUsage: <EntityTree entities={entities} expandedIds={expandedEntityIds} onExpand={handleExpand} onSelect={handleSelect} filter={entityFilter} childCounts={childCounts} selectedId={activeEntityId} />
childComponents.description: Displays a hierarchical, expandable tree of entities with child count badges, permission/visibility indicators, and integrated search/filtering.
childComponents.functionalRequirements:
‚Ä¢ Renders entity hierarchy based on ParentID and childCounts.
‚Ä¢ Supports expand/collapse nodes with keyboard and mouse events.
‚Ä¢ Displays child entity counts as badges.
‚Ä¢ Highlights selected node.
‚Ä¢ Filters entities by search, type, or permission.
‚Ä¢ Shows permission/visibility status.
‚Ä¢ Triggers selection callbacks on click/keyboard.

dynamicData.description: Builds and renders hierarchical tree with expand/collapse, including real-time filters.

childComponents.technicalDesign: Uses a virtualized tree renderer for large sets. Node expansion controlled via expandedIds prop. Filters/search pre-process data. ARIA attributes, rolenames, and keyboard nav (arrow, enter, space) for accessibility. Permission filtering handled at data transform.

childComponents.description: Shows the navigation path from the root to the current entity, enabling click-to-navigate back to ancestors.
childComponents.functionalRequirements:
‚Ä¢ Displays clickable list of entities in the selection ancestry (breadcrumb).
‚Ä¢ Updates as tree selection changes.
‚Ä¢ Allows keyboard navigation between crumbs.
‚Ä¢ Supports ARIA labeling.

requiredEntities.usageContext: Fetch name for each ID in breadcrumbTrail

childComponents.technicalDesign: Maps breadcrumbTrail state to display names, renders as accessible list. Click/keyboard event triggers navigation event.

childComponents.description: Displays detailed entity and field metadata in selectable grids, with dual technical/business tabbed views and permission/impact info.
childComponents.functionalRequirements:
‚Ä¢ Presents entity summary (description, created/modified dates).
‚Ä¢ Field grid: Name, Type, Description, Relationship, Permission, and Business Impact.
‚Ä¢ Dual tab interface ('Technical', 'Business') for view modes.
‚Ä¢ Clicking a field triggers drill-down/detail.
‚Ä¢ Shows permission icons/labels.
childComponents.technicalDesign: Uses tabbed interface for view mode switching. Accessible table includes ARIA, focus, and keyboard nav. Field selection updates global/focused state. Business/Technical explanatory content separated by tab.

childComponents.description: Visualizes the currently selected entity‚Äôs structure and relationships to other entities in an ERD-style diagram.
childComponents.functionalRequirements:
‚Ä¢ Renders nodes for entities, edges for relationships (parent, references).
‚Ä¢ Supports zoom/pan and focus on active entity.
‚Ä¢ Displays tooltip/summary on hover.
‚Ä¢ Honors show/hide flag for panel/modal toggle.

dynamicData.description: Pulls relationships for currently viewed entity and related entities for schema visualization.

childComponents.technicalDesign: Uses SVG or canvas-based rendering (d3 or light custom renderer). Focus/selection state managed via props. Diagram panning/zooming controlled by mouse/touch/keyboard. Accessibility via labels and ARIA for nodes.

childComponents.description: Provides global search input and filter controls for entity type and permission filtering.
childComponents.functionalRequirements:
‚Ä¢ Fuzzy search as-you-type support.
‚Ä¢ Filter pills/checkboxes for entity type and field permissions.
‚Ä¢ Accessible input and filter controls.
‚Ä¢ Triggers results update callbacks.

dynamicData.description: Used to implement live global search and filtering.

childComponents.technicalDesign: Controlled input and checkboxes. Handles debounce for search. Exposes ARIA attributes on controls. Triggers update callbacks on change.

childComponents.description: Shows an in-depth detail view of a field, including contextual explanation, usage stats, version/change history.
childComponents.functionalRequirements:
‚Ä¢ Slides out as modal/drawer when field is selected.
‚Ä¢ Presents technical/business detail, usage stats, and version history.
‚Ä¢ Supports keyboard trap and close-on-Escape.
childComponents.technicalDesign: Modal drawer with ARIA modal semantics, keyboard trap. Receives field ID/props, fetches details if not present. Esc/close icon closes drawer.

title: Entity Metadata Explorer
